rc_desc: Speculations over his dismissal after resent struggles with parliament
An implisit call for Carlsen's resignation because he stands weak within the party
Carlsen is described as a weak minister, and a call for dismissal is placed
Speculations over his dismissal after resent struggles with parliament
States that it is understandable that Fjeld was considering his position leading to his leave of absence
According to VG, two editor articles in "Arbeiderbladet" asks for Hauge's resignation because of military dissatisfaction with him as leader.
MP Utheim with a statement in parliament that Hauge might be met with "more than words" for his incorrect dispositions
Several MPs argue that Hauge is responsible for a series of thefts at military facilities
No thourogh description. It just states that Hauge is "unsavable"
After the dismissal of the military chief, the paper says it is likely that Hauge will fall with him. Also, the characterise him as unpopular within the military and so on
Three generals leaves post as a protest against Hauge
It is reported that the opposition has silently gathered to discuss Hauges dismissal in the Helset-canse
Speculations over his dismissal after resent struggles with parliament
A gathered oposition calls for Hauge's resignation after the "Helset-scandal" through a vote of non-confidence
All the major newspapers are reported to demand Hauges dismissal for the handling of the "Helset-scandal"
Hambro demands Hauges dismissal to stabalize the situation of the military

dismis_note: Asked for own dismissal because his job as recovery minister was done
Asked for his own dismissal after beeing appointed as general secretary (UN)
Died in his leave of absence

rc_desc: Torp orders a vote of confidence over recovery questions
MP Utheim asked for Torp's dismissal over the question of economic recovery after the war
Speculations over his dismissal after resent struggles with parliament
MP Oftedal demands Langhelle's resignation if the airport at Sola is not saved

dismis_note: No reason given for his dismissal

rc_desc: No thourogh description. It states that Evensen is one of the ministers under fire in the current government
Brofoss asks for a vote of confidence over a question on national debt
In relation to Gerhardsen's resignation as PM, papers are speculation that Brofoss should follow him out of office

dismis_note: Got sick and hospitalized

rc_desc: A proposal from the opposition is seen as a call for the resigantion of the government
In a parliamentary session, MP Leirfall asks for Hauges resignation over a  militart personell issue
Huge is described as imature for his position
Hauge is implisitly asked to resign, because he has too many scalps in his buckle
In relation to Gerhardsen's resignation as PM, papers are speculation that Hauge should follow him out of office
Is reported to be pressured out of the cabinet in relation to the Torp transaction

dismis_note: Drogseth was the temporary replacement of Evensen
Return after sick leave
No reason given for her dismissal
Leave of absence

rc_desc: Gundersen is reported to soon be leaving office, but denies the claim a week later
dismis_note: Said he was tired and had thought about quitting for a while (was part of the cabinet since 1945)
Hauges dismissal was well known to come at the start of the year as a consequence of the PM switch

rc_desc: From the bat, Langhelle is described as unfit for the position as minister of defense. Mostly, the reason is that he has been weak as Minister of Transport and Communications.

dismis_note: Seems to have been sick for a long time. A stroke was recorded in August.

rc_desc: Vote of no confidence from Liberals and Agrarians
Saw a parliamentary decision as a vote of no confidence in relation to the Østenrute case

dismis_note: Brofoss wanted to leave the cabinet from the start, but a replacement was hard to come by. Eventually he was given leave

rc_desc: A vote of no confidence is raised towards Handal for his handeling of the crisis in Aura.
The paper describes Handal sa a weak minister, especially after the handeling of Aura

dismis_note: Reshuffle

rc_desc: It is reported that a position as head of agriculture in Sogn og Fjordane is unfilled because Nordbø is to be dismissed from the cabinet
Controversies around the question of 18 months long service time in the military leads to questions around Torps cabinet
Vote of confidence called by Torp
Inner conflict in the Labor Party results in a statement from a party member that "I would take my hat and leave" if I was Torp.
Before his assignment, Sjaastad meets questions of impartiality due to his close ties with LO
Sjaastad is singled out to be dismissed and described as a "weak link" in the cabinet
No spesific reason given, but Bergersen is reported to leave office.
A vote of no confidence after the government proposes to increase the members in the Science Council from 3 to 5 members
A vote of confidence from MP Leirfall over the question of price on meat
A vote of no confidence pointed towards the cabinet for breaking the allocation regulations in the case of price subsidies
Handal is not reentered on the election list of the Labor Party in Bergen, and speculations arise on his position in the cabinet
The paper "Vårt Land" demands Handals head on a plate for his weak administrative handeling.

dismis_note: Withdrew from his position after being defeted on a proposal in parliament
Leave of absence
Lid was highly regarder, but resigned for healt reasons. He also had some controversies with PM Gerhardsen

rc_desc: Morgenbladet is reported to belive that Meisdalshagen is to leave office because of inner controversies in the Labor Party
Meisdalshagen is reported to have little time left in office. His position in Norges Kooperative Lansforbund is believed to disturb his job as minister
Sjaastad asks for a vote of confidence in parliament
The paper reports that it is likely that Sjaastad will not be a part of the new cabinet
The paper argues that Løbak has made a bad figure, and is not seen as the right man for the job
Løbak is described as administratively weak, and his probable dismissal announced

dismis_note: Asked to be relieved

rc_desc: Vote of no confidence towards the cabinet for selling wepons to Cuba
Also targeted for the Cuba-affair by the opposition
Løbak recieves critisizm from the Farmer's Association for his work in the Agrarian Deparment. Dissatisfaction has decreased to the extent that they consider forming a new party.
The majority of parliament stands against Løbak in a proposition to merge the agrarian schools Ås and Sem.
The majority of parliament stands against Løbak in a proposition to merge the agrarian schools Ås and Sem.

dismis_note: Steps back at the age of 73 (the oldest member of any post-WWII cabinet in Norway)

rc_desc: Sjaastad is belived to resign because he is pressured by his constituency.

Sjaastad has withheld information regarding competition between several sement factories, and the newspaper is making it clear that he must face responsibility for his actions (a few days earlier the same sentiments are articulated in the paper)
Bøe dissents on the question of EU, and is demanding to leave office, while Gerhardsen won't let him. The paper says he should be able to leave his post
PM Gerhardsen tries to squeeze Bratteli into the shadows of the party during the yearly party conference
A series of articles on a scandal in a hospital in Northern Norway. A "need to clean up the Department of Health" is raised.
dismis_note: Died in his post during the Christmas holliday

rc_desc: A vote of no confidence is raised towards the cabinet for the appointment of Harald Bakkane as head of the police acadamy
MP Leirfall calls for a vote of no confidence against the sitting cabinet, following the Kings Bay scandal
Harsh comment in the newspaper following the Kings Bay scandal. Says that any private company making these kind of mistakes would have had to pay the highest price for its failings
The Socialist People's Party wants Gerhardsen removed, but not the Labor cabinet, as a consequence of the Kings Bay accident
dismis_note: The cabinet lost the vote of no confidence and had to resign

rc_desc: The paper reports that parliament will direct a vote of no confidence towards Holler for his involment in the Kings Bay scandal

A column in the paper is highly critical towards the fact that PM Gerhardsen mad the vote of no confidence against Holler into a vote against the cabinet. The paper argues that Holler is the only one that should go following the Kings Bay scandal
Socialist People's Party with a vote of no confidence against Lange over the question of EU and negotiations in Brussels
Ålesunds Rederiforening asks for Lysøs dismissal, because he has not followed their advice to put forward a proposal regarding "lottgaranti" sooner.

dismis_note: Resigned for personal reasons
Resigned for personal reasons

rc_desc: Call for cabinet resignation from SF (w/ Gustavsen)
Vote of no confidence from the Labor Party
dismis_note: The cabinet resigned over a negative majority vote of no confidence from DNA

rc_desc: The Labor Party wants to remove Bratteli from his position as minister to strengthen their own parliamentary group
"Bondelaget" declares that it has no confidence in the sitting cabinet.
After the Minister of Industry, Karl Trasti, states that there has not been any industry scandals in his department, Fredrikstad Blad argues that the cabinet should get dismissed
"Strong voices" demands that Gjærevoll has to go, due to a trial on the issue of illegal expropriation of "Svane-apoteket"

dismis_note: Leave of absence

rc_desc: A proposal from the opposition is seen as a call of no confidence against Bondevik in the case of regulating NRK (the national TV station)
Vote of no confidence towards Bondevik from Guttorm Hansen following the "Nasty-case"
The weekly magasine "Aktuell" says that the only way to get rid of Bondevik is if he was to willingly leave his office.
Bondeviks position is questioned by the opposition (mainly DNA) following his position towards a teacher's academy in Bergen
Guttorm Hansen, form DNA, says that if the cabinet had been a single-party cabinet, Bondevik would be dismissed after the Gymnasium-case
A indirect but clear vote of no confidence against the cabinet after the "Nasty-case" from DNA

The paper reports that Lyngs own party in parliament is sceptical towards his statement in UN on the question of Vietnam. The paper says that he will have to be replaced if he does not answer for himself.

VG implisittly calls for Lyngstad's resignation by stating that there is so few votes of confidence currently that they want to delve deeper into the a case where the department invalidated elections of "jordstyre" in two municipallities

dismis_note: Left office because he got sick

rc_desc: Guttorm Hansen, form DNA, says that if the cabinet had been a single-party cabinet, Willoch would be dismissed after the "borregaard-case"
Culture expert Kåre Siem argues that he will "raise the flag when Bondevik finally leaves office"
The Labor Party sets forth a vote of no confidence against the cabinet over tax issues
The Centre Party themselves place a great deal of mistrust in Borten and wants him to move the party into opposition, because of EEC-differences with their coalition partners
After a secret document, sent from the ambassador in Brussels, is leaked to the press from a person that heard about it from Borten, VG demands Bortens dismissal (not the cabinet)
The Labor Party wants the cabinet to resign, and if it does not they might set forward a vote of no confidence
dismis_note: The cabinet resigned over leakages to the press in EEC-related matters. Borten did not receive enough support from his own party and decided to resign. http://web.retriever-info.com/services/archive/displayPDF?documentId=05501619701008AR00303&serviceId=2

Lyng is for a long time known to be considering his position. There are no resignation calls, but it is obvious that he leaves office because of differences with Borten over EEC. However, he states that he leaves because he wants younger people to get a chance, and not for any political or personal disagreements with anyone.
Asked for dismissal because he was soon to be 70 years old

rc_desc: Because of inner struggles in the Liberal Party over the question of membership in EEC, Seip is called for to resign -- he is seen as a person who can save the party from within

dismis_note: Withdrew from her position to apply for the position in the Supreme Court
Dismissed after being elected as chairman of the Conservative Party

rc_desc: Sp wanted Stray to resign as Minister of Foreign Affairs back in 1971, VG reveals
dismis_note: Involved in two major scandals, but surprisingly no resignation calls. The Minister of Foreign Affairs is never criticized…

rc_desc: Erling Engan acuses the cabinet for not telling the whole story of the negotiation with EU. His proposal is considered a vote of no confidence, and he withdrew it thereafter
dismis_note: Cabinet resigns when the referendum on EEC-membership fails
Department discontinued (Pris og lønning)

rc_desc: Newspaper argues that it is hard to see how Hoem can stay in office after he refused to vote for EEC-membership. Political elites within DNA, including PM Bratteli, is reported to have no choice
dismis_note: Dismissed after refusing to sign aggreement with EEC

rc_desc: The paper speculates that Bræk will not survive after stating that the majority of parliament is acting unresponsible in the case of how the oil in the North Sea should be dealt with
The paper speculates that Eika could be dismissed in relation to the trade aggreement proposal with EF
The Conservative Party gives advice to PM Korvald to drop Eika from the cabinet after the Crotale scandal

dismis_note: Only one article on Haugeland. Secondary sources states that he was given leave because he was sick
Did recive heavy criticizm for the Crotale scandal

rc_desc: Vote of no confidence against the cabinet following the Croate scandal
dismis_note: The cabinet is seen as a caretaker government by everyone except themselves

rc_desc: In a case of impartiality, Olsen is recommended to step back by H and DNA
Vote of no confidence from ALP towards the cabinet
MP Kristensen demands that Bratteli makes way for Nordli
The Labor Party, with Norli and Steen as the front figures, goes in for removing Bratteli from hist position as party leader, and hence, also as PM

dismis_note: Died of cancer

rc_desc: Sagør gets some criticizm for a proposition on founding to the media. Especially, the Conservatives are angry, and openly considers a vote of no confidence
A vote of no confidence towards Ulvseth after the Ecofish scandal from Anders Langes Parti
After a employee in his department is charged with espionage, Evensen is implisittly adviced to leave office in a series of articles

Vote of confidence called by Nordli

dismis_note: Last Nordli I
Withdrew from his position without any drama
Replaced with the central figure, Reiulf Steen.

rc_desc: In a broad sweep from the Labor press, this article, among others, asks for the resignation of Bolle
Ultimatum from fishermen that Bolle must either increase the fishing kvota or leave his office

dismis_note: Placed in the Storting "to go the PM school"
Is said to have wanted to leave office for a while. He wants to og back to his position as "fylkesrådmann"

rc_desc: The article speculates that Evensen will have to og if his department is shut down

Reshuffle
Reshuffle

dismis_note: Well in advance of her dismissal, it is well known that Lorentzen wants to take a break from government duties

rc_desc: A series of articles report that Nordli is unpopular within the party, and that many would like him to be replaced

dismis_note: Reshuffle

rc_desc: Newspaper describes Valle as a burden for the cabinet, and anticipate her dismissal soon

Gjerde argues that he is leaving office because he is tired after nine years in government. He was also regarded as highly popular within the electorate

rc_desc: In light of the Tandeberg scandal, Haukvik stands on fire according to the opposition
In a broad sweep from the Labor press, this article, among others, asks for the resignation of Haukvik
In a broad sweep from the Labor press, this article, among others, asks for the resignation of Jordahl
In a broad sweep from the Labor press, this article, among others, asks for the resignation of Myklevoll

Reported to have unwillingly acceped the post, and wanted it to last as shortly as possible
Hansen is seen as the natural successor of Nordli, and "uncontroversial".

rc_desc: The editor of Nordlys (Labor Party press) openly admits that they want to replace Steen as party leade, and, hence, also from his post as minister

dismis_note: Says she leaves because she is tired

rc_desc: A vote of no confidence against Førde for hiring the AOF-leader as Principal Officer of his own department
After declining an application for funding from a healt centre for drug addicts, the opposition wants Nilsen's head on a plate.
MP Reiulf Steen wants Austad to be dismissed after budget negotiations in parliament

rc_desc: Arbeidernes Pressekontor demands Bratz' dismissal after the Tofte-case
A project to extract ilmenite in Tyssedal gets more expensive than Bratz reports to parliment. The opposition reacts with a vote of no confidence

dismis_note: Langslets position gets its own department

rc_desc: DNA with a vote of no confidence against Sjaastad in relation to "Rakett-saken", because he allegedly did not report all the information to parliament
extra_note: There are several sources for this RC

rc_desc: A call for Sjaastad's resignation for trying to create a lack of confidence with parliament
DNA party leader, Gro H. B., says that the Willoch-ship must sink because it sails in dirty waters

In an evaluation of the cabinet, Listau is reported to "sit on his termination letter" due to being very anonymous.
KrF has no trust in the minister after a new law on violence in videos is proposed
In an evaluation of the cabinet, Røkke is reported to "sit on her termination letter" due to her handeling of the pornography law.
H's coalition partners thinks that Stray is a burden for the cabinet.
An editorial article argues that Stray is politically dead, and needs to be replaced
A Sp vetaran demands Surlien's dismissal after, allegedly failing in three cases. He characterize the minister as a failed experiment.

rc_desc: Trygve Hegnar argues that if he was Willoch he would've resigned to take a postion as CEO of Norges Bank

The opposition is not happy with Sjaastad's statement that he supports Ronald Reagan's "Star Wars"
SV's Kvanmo threathens the minister with a vote of no confidence for his slander towards the Sør-Varanger mayor
Vote of no confidence for employing Einar Førde chief of broadcasting

The "Labor press" wants Bakken to resign (no reason given)
Same as below, only here from own party
Same as below, only here from opposition

rc_desc: The "Labor press" wants Berge to resign (no reason given)

Repeted questions to Borgen on whether he will resign after his humiliating defeat in the airport case
The paper argues that the minister must resign over the Ila case'
Hanna Kanmo (SV) wants Bøsterud removed as quickly as possible for her handeling of the Ila case
Former police officer Lier wants a new Minister of Justice, based on the lack of knowledge Bøsterud has shown in her post
Editorial argues that Brundtland has to realize that Bøsterud does not have the confidence required in parliament, and thus has to replace her
Former minister (in the same cabinet), Sellæg wants Bøsterud to be replaced due to her general handeling of her department.
Vote of no confidence against the cabinet
Jostein Berntsen, a leading person within DNA, wants the PM to resign from her position as party leader, and thus also her cabinet
DNA members from northern Norway wants Eidem to resign, stating that he is the worst Minister of Fisheries ever

dismis_note: Died

rc_desc: Rolf Presthus (H) threathens the minister with a vote of no confidence if she does not withdraw the decision to refuse the establishment of a private hospital on Mesnali
Norsk Faglærerlag wants Grøndahl removed because she failed to increase the teacher's wages, as she promised

dismis_note: Went back to LO, after the sitting leader took sick leave

rc_desc: Vote of no confidence against Holst from FrP
Carl I. Hagen (FrP) will consider a vote of no confidence towards Holst after failing to inform parliament on a u-boat accident
Norsk Sjømannsforbund demands that Mosbakk has to go because he will not withdraw a letter he sent to Norsk Rederiforbund, stating that it is not necessary for sailors to negotiate tariff aggreements
Arne Fjørtoft (V) wants Øyangen's head for misinforming the opposition in parliament
Bellona wants Rønbeck to leave office for her failed environmental policies
Arne Fjørtoft (V) wants Rønbeck's head for misinforming the opposition in parliament
Eirik Solheim (SV) wants Rønbeck to resign and come over to his party, because she is, according to him, neglected in her current party
The "Labor press" wants Vetlesen to resign (no reason given)
Rettedal (H) says that Borgen needs to do his job, or resign

dismis_note: Withdrew for personal reasons

rc_desc: Sp wants Jakobsen to come back to parliament, to strengthen the party's position there
NSB employees demands Lie's resignation after he has not prevented 1100 of the staff to be dismissed
Lie himself threatens to resign if road funds are used to cover Olympics costs
Nyland (DNA) argues that Lie is not mature enough to handle his post after Lie refuses to answer questions in parliament
The fish industry wants Munkejord to resign for implementing too small quotas for fishing in Northern Norway
Voices within H wants to remove Sellæg as they are not happy with her performance
Carl I. Hagen (FrP) says that it is not a theoretical possibility that Thommassen or the cabinet will be met with a vote of no confidence in parliament
Solheim (SV) wants the cabinet to resign
All party leaders within the coalition aggree that the cabinet must resign
Voices within H wants to remove Thomassen, as they are not happy with his performance
Carl I. Hagen (FrP) says that it is not a theoretical possibility that Thommassen or the cabinet will be met with a vote of no confidence in parliament
Sp is considering how to replace Valla after her being slaughtered by the press
Bellona wants the minister to be replaced for her environmental policies
Bellona goes to war against the minister in hope of her dismissal
The youth wing in the Labor Party wants Brundtland to go.
H asks for a vote of no confidence after the Uni-Storbrand scandal.

rc_desc: Fellesforbundet is arguing that Gerhardsen has to go due to her many statements without backing
The leader of Hotell- og retaurantarbeiderforbundet has no confidence in Gerhardsen anymore, and wants her dismissal
Article demanding Gerhardsen's head on a plate
dismis_note: Withdrew because her department got stripped without her having a say

rc_desc: Gundersen (FrP) demands Gjesteby's dismissal for her handeling of the Koch case
Paper demands Gjesteby's dismissal for misinforming parliament
For not giving complete information on the Koch case, Lunde (SV) wants Gjesteby to resign or face a vote of no confidence
FrP wants to impeach Gjesteby (see above)
Also H wants to remove Gjesteby (see above)
Carl I. Hagen (FrP) argues that impeachment is an option in the Holst-case, where Holst ignored a act of parliament to move "luftkontrollinspektoratet"

Editorial argues that enough is enough with Holst. He has been called into parliament to give an explanation on a meeting with Russian elites. The only reason he still has his position is that the parliamentary situation is difficult
Romerikets blad editorial demands that Johnsen resigns because of the crisis in Storebrand
Vote of no confidence (same case as above)
Kleveland is accused for discrimination of the TV channel TVNorge by FrP, and they are open to demand a vote of no cofidence over the case
After Knapp himself went out arguing that the Department of Industries and the Department of Oil and Energy should be merged, the paper argues that it would be unwise not to dismiss him.

rc_desc: Einar Johansen, a prominent person within the fish industry, wants Berge, Øyangen, and Kristensen to resign because the cabinet is biased towards the "yes-side" on the EU matter
Carl I. Hagen (FrP) is ready to propose a vote of no confidence against Nordbø for the EØS aggreement she reached
Newspaper argues that under normal circumstances the minister would have been dismissed for celebrating the success of the EØS negotiation
dismis_note: Nordbø is allegedly resigning because of family reasons. Some argue that it is a strategic resignation after the EØS aggreement is done

rc_desc: SP, with Viken in front, is furious with Øyangen because she has made critical remarks on Norwegian farmers
Einar Johansen, a prominent person within the fish industry, wants Berge, Øyangen, and Kristensen to resign because the cabinet is biased towards the "yes-side" on the EU matter
Article demanding Pettersen's head on a plate

dismis_note: Sandman is allegedly resigning because of family reasons. It is, however, "known" that he is oposing EF…

rc_desc: A proposition from SV to widthdraw a export licence for the US was in parliament evolves to become a understood vote of no confidence against the minister
dismis_note: Resigned to take position as mediator in Jugoslavia

rc_desc: FrP will put forward a vote of no confidence when the minister wants to move two handicapped elderly people from one institution to another
Article claiming that Veierød has done poorly, and might have to be replaced
A reporter argues that Berget has to resign because she is pregnant, mostly to send a signal to other mothers
Einar Johansen, a prominent person within the fish industry, wants Berge, Øyangen, and Kristensen to resign because the cabinet is biased towards the "yes-side" on the EU matter
District Sheriffs demands that Faremo is sacked, because the cabinet withdrew a new police law.

Mayor of Drammen, Christoffersen (DNA), urges Brundtland to resign and give way to Jagland

The leader for Lensmannsetatens Landslag argues that Faremo has to go if she does not comprehend the conflict within the police.

Stoltenberg asks for a vote of confidence.

LO says that nothing can save Rød-Larsen after it is revealed that he has a shady economic past (asked the Bird leadership to break the stock-law). Økokrim also considers to sue him.
In the Rød-Larsen case, the paper argues in a five point list the reasons that Rød-Larsen should be dismissed

Dagbladet is reported to demand that Valla resigns, and VG is close to arguing in the same lines. This is because she "let herself" get elected as vice chairman of LO, and therefore is prioritizing LO over the cabinet
FrP argues that Aure must resign after a poll stating that half of the population says that FrP has the best crime policies
Simonsen (FrP) wonders when Aure will resign so that "we can get a Minister of Justice with more vigor.'
dismis_note: Withdrew from politics for health reasons

rc_desc: Kleppe (FrP) wants parliament to propose a vote of no confidence against Haugland after she has argued that single gays to adopt children
A large group of ananonymous sources from within the cabinet argues that Lahnstein will resign.
Meland (Sp) wants Lahnstein to move Sp out of the cabinet
SV is considering a vote of no confidence against Lilletun because he is about to fire a gay priest
An allegedly central member of KrF's parliamentary group wants Lilletun removed if Stålsett keeps his position
A group of KrF members openly demands Lilletuns dismissal
Paper describes Sponheim as a whiny kid, and asks him to step back
Petersen (H) argues that Sponheim should leave office because he stated that the cabinet's policies are unacceptable
Sponheim's own political advisor recommends to withdraw from the cabinet
DNA and FrP threatens Sponheim with no confidence over the deadline to hire a company for IT solutions on the airport in Oslo
Understood vote of no confidence towards the cabinet after heavy critizism of Sponheim in parliament
Vote of confidence over the SIVA aggreement
dismis_note: The cabinet lost the vote of  confidence and had to resign

rc_desc: The whole bord in the postal service threaten to resign because of Fjærevoll's detailed managing
In the Postal Servica case, the newspaper argues that the PM must stand his ground towards Fjærvoll
Editorial argues that Fjærvoll has to go for misinforming parliament in the TELIANOR case
Fjærevoll threatens parliament with a vote of confidence over the Telianor case

dismis_note: Last Bondevik I

rc_desc: Lønning (H) declares that he could ask for a vote of confidence against the minister over the Oasen school case
Gabrielsen (H) threathened with a vote of no confidence over Hanssen's post if he was to do a campaign for a chain store (RIMI)
Carl I. Hagen (FrP) asks for a vote of no confidence over the Gholam-case
H and FrP wants to remove Knudsen for misinforming parliament on the case of share increase in Telenor
Control and Constitution committee threatens with a vote of no confidence for Orheim's decision to refuse an application of adoption
Restad (Sp) argues that the cabinet should consider its position

Carl I. Hagen (FrP) makes it clear that the cabinet must either align to parliaments will or resign, after they have presented a proposition that goes against a previously accepted parliamentary resolution
Carl I. Hagen announced that the cabinet did not have the confidence of FrP anymore, and that they should therefore resign
The Ombudsman for Children demands Clemet's dismissal if bullying in schools is not drastically reduced
Djupedal (SV) demands that Dåvøy is dismissed for doing a bad job.
Nybakk (DNA) threatens Devold to either resign or let personell in the military remain in their jobs
The leader for Norway's Officer Union, Moe, wants Devold to be removed.
Engebretsen (DNA) advices Stoltenberg to put forward a vote of no confidence against Devold because the Ministry of Defence has gotten criticizm for budget handeling several times
An opinion poll shows that a relative majority of the population (49%) wants Devold removed
FrP proposed a vote of no confidence against the minister, but it did not get the required votes
extra_note: Extra source: http://web.retriever-info.com/services/archive/displayDocument?documentId=0550162005012113315481&serviceId=2  --  There are several articles on this resignation call, starting with this, and ending with the one that is reported as main source

rc_desc: Ellingsen (FrP) argues that Dørum is not in sync with the population, and wants the minister to consider his position
Jensen (FrP) argues that Haugland either must bend for parliamentary resolutions or resign, after Haugland has indicated that she wants to slow down a parliamentary resolution
After the horrible municipality election for KrF, the paper argues that Haugland should be removed.
A group of KrF mayors demands that Haugland is dismissed after a bad municipality election.
Paper argues that Haugland must resign to make way for new leadership within KrF
NOAH (animal protection organization) started a campaign to get rid of the minister because he has plans to let other countries participate in seal hunting
Bakken, fisher and member of the Conservative party, argues that the minister should resign because the industry is frustrated with regulations
Carl I. Hagen (FrP) believes that Norman is done as minister after Norman has broken a variety of laws
Sylvi Holte (Norsk Tjenestemannslag) also argues that Norman should resign (see above)
Leader of LO, Gerd Liv Valla, argues that Norman does not fit for his position and should resign
After the tsunami in Thailand, a group of citizens wants Petersen to resign because they did not get any help in searching for survivors
Jennie Johnsen (V) argues that Schou should be replaced with Skogsholm
According to "central members" within the coalition, Schou is one of the ministers that is ripe for leave
The new leader of the Conservative Party, Erna Solberg, is reported to want Schou replaced because she "does not sell her policies good enough"
DNA and SV considers a vote of no confidence against Skogsholm because she has withheld information regarding restructuring of "Veivesenet"
Aud Folkestad (V) resigns from the party in protest against Sponheim, and argues that he should rather resign than desperately hold his position
Members of Venstre wants Sponheim to resign after a horrible municipality election
After Haugland argued that the three leaders of the Liberals should not be in cabinet at the same time, Steensnæs says he is willing to resign
Carl I. Hagen (FrP) argues that Steensnæs has failed in handeling the electricity crisis, and that he can not possibly become more weak than he is now
Bellona demands that Bjørnøy resigns because she "does not understand her responsibilities" according to its leader, Fredric Hauge
Editorial argues that Bjørnøy is weak and has made no progress for the environment in her post. "It will not be shocking if she was to be replaced first"
SV's vice president in parliament argues that both Bjørnøy and Djupedal should be replaced because they are too weak
Both members of SV and DNA wants Bjørnøy removed after weak performance and disapointing municipality election
SV's vice president in parliament argues that both Bjørnøy and Djupedal should be replaced because they are too weak
Sources within the coalition is reported to want Enoksen replaced with Arnstad
Erna Solberg (H) argues that Halvorsen must consider her position after increasing the maximum price of kindergarden places
Several members of SV argues that Halvorsen should resign from the cabinet after supporting Norwegian involvement in Afghanistan
Carl I. Hagen (FrP) believes that Hanssen will resign after his handeling of the hospital vage crisis
Per Sandberg (FrP) argues that Naversete should consider her position if two road directors are not sacked.
dismis_note: Leave of absence
Leave of absence
Leave of absence

rc_desc: Siv Jensen (FrP) threatens Strøm-Erichsen with a vote of no confidence for misinforming parliament
Editorial asks for Haga's dismissal after she has illegaly rented out a storehouse for 10 years
Siv Jensen (FrP) states that her party has no confidence in Ramin-Osmundsen
Editorial argues that Ramin-Osmundsen lacks political intuition, and that har future in is in the hands of Stoltenberg
Siv Jensen (FrP) argues that Ramin-Osmundsen should consider her position after it is revealed that she hired a friend as Ombudsman for Children

dismis_note: Resigned 18 days earlier because he was elected president of parliament

rc_desc: Local groups within Sp wants to replace Brekk with Borten Moe
Vote of no confidence from the opposition in relation to Røkke selling several companies to the partially sate-owned Aker Solutions

dismis_note: Last Stoltenberg II

Dismissed after Lysbakken overtakes the control of the Socialist Left Party (article stating that it's the party leader's responsibility to chose ministers: http://web.retriever-info.com/services/archive/displayDocument?documentId=05501620120224DOC63Q09JL6EKPYDIC7JZD&serviceId=2

rc_desc: After the terrorist attacks 22.07, Asasrud is under hard criticism from a report. A opinion poll shows that 36% wants her removal.
Berg-Hansen is one of the owners of a company that is sued for environmental crime. Professor of Law, Fleischer, argues that it might be smart for her to resign to not hurt the cabinet
Editor article states that it is hard to see how Berg-Hansen can survive (case described above)
Central sources in the Labor Party says that Berg-Hansen sits closest to the door

dismis_note: Leave of absence

rc_desc: Brekk is one of the ministers party leader of the Centre Party, Naversete, is considering to replace

dismis_note: Reshuffle

rc_desc: SV veteran, Rolf Reikvam, states that Halvorsen should consider her position after a bad opinion poll
The newspaper argues that Kleppa should be sacrificed to make way for younger people.
The Centre Party recives illegal funding from Eidsiva Energi, then Kleppa hires the CEO to vice chairman of Avinor. Newspapers seems to not like it…
Centre Party sources argues that Kleppa will fall at the next reshuffle to make way for the new vice-chairman Borten Moe.

Center Party member Pollestad says that Kleppa is the perfect person to take over the position as head of her own home county (Rogaland). By doing this, he implicitly calls for her dismissal from the cabinet.
dismis_note: This RC comes at Kleppas last day in office

rc_desc: Editorial argues that Naversete has to take responsibility for the illegal election funding (see Kleppa)
PR expert, Geelmuyden, says that Naversete has to consider her position after the founding scandal
Sources within the Centre Party says that Naversete has to go after the founding scandal
dismis_note: http://web.retriever-info.com/services/archive/displayDocument?documentId=0550162011011441113014&serviceId=2

rc_desc: Sp veteran, Kolbjørn Almlid, wants Naversete to resign, and Borten-Moe to overtake the party leadership (BortenMoe-Naversete conflict)
Environment organization demands Riis-Johansens dismissal after the gass factory on Mongstad is postponed for four years
Editorial wants a vote of no confidence against the minister after the revelations about his proceedings in the Mongstad-case
FrP and KrF has no confidence in the minister after he hid some information on the building of the gass factory on Mongstad (also a vote of no confidence is raised -- see dismis_note link)
dismis_note: http://web.retriever-info.com/services/archive/displayDocument?documentId=0550162010061838928357&serviceId=2

rc_desc: LO leader, Hans Felix, calls for Riis-Johansens head after disaggreements over which companies should operate stately owned power factories
Party leader of FrP, Siv Jensen, demands Riis-Johansens dismissal after he recommended building power wires over Hardangervidda arguing that it was the best option.
Newspaper argued that Riis-Johansen has to go after the Hardanger-case
Leader of Bellona, Frederic Hauge, argues that the minister must either find funding for Mongstad or leave office
dismis_note: Dismissed after Lysbakken overtakes the control of the Socialist Left Party (article stating that it's the party leader's responsibility to chose ministers: http://web.retriever-info.com/services/archive/displayDocument?documentId=05501620120224DOC63Q09JL

rc_desc: Conservative Party leader for Akerhus demands the cabinets resignation over the failures related to the terroist attacks 22.07.2011
Editorial demands that Stoltenberg steps back after the 22 July commision report is published
Professor in medical ethics argues that Stoltenberg is not worth popular trust after the 22 July commision report

dismis_note: Leave of absence

rc_desc: H and FrP puts forward a vote of no confidence against Støre accordingly for corruption in the Tschaudi-case
The Progress Party (Korsberg) demands that Strøm-Erichsen has to go after reciveing two Afghanian carpets and failing to report their true value to tax authorities.
dismis_note: Reshuffle

rc_desc: Berger Røsland (H) demands Strøm-Erichsens dismissal after a series of alleged scandals in the health sector
An editorial argues that Strøm-E. is hanged to dry publicly by the PM, after he rejects her proposals on banning toys in unhealthy foods. The article states that it seems like a indirect dismissal.
Family members of several mistreated patients asks for the ministers dismissal
Sources within the Labor Party informs that Bjurstrøm has had problems to coordinate with the parliamentary group. They argue that she will "be moved"
dismis_note: Might have been pushed out to make space for the upcoming Hadia Tajik: http://web.retriever-info.com/services/archive/displayDocument?documentId=05501620120922DOC66Q9WH1CT61LNNYUEE&serviceId=2

rc_desc: Opinion poll where over 50% asks for Lysbakkens resignation
A party veteran from the Socialist Left Party says that either Lysbakken or his State Secretaries has to go after the founding scandal
An editorial argues that Lysbakken has to be dismissed after the women's defense founding scandal -- under the headline "A bit corrupt, a bit socialist"
Storberget recives a lot of criticizm for the lack of readiness of the police and military after the terrorist attacks. Here an editorial sets him as the responsible person.
extra_note: Remable how little criticizm the ministers, especially Storberget, gets after 22-07

rc_desc: Editorial in the paper asks for Storbergets dismissal after a wave of rape cases in Oslo.
dismis_note: Resigned after massive pressure following the commision report
extra_note: Link to comment, because the article itself was only published online

rc_desc: Strøm-E. has used up her failure quota says Ellingsen (FrP) after a case where she has threatened military leaders with wiring their phones
